alert.note: Alert for South Laramie Range (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 01 at 1:58PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm with a reported funnel cloud will impact portions of southwestern Laramie County through 230 PM MDT... At 158 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm capable of producing a landspout near Warren AFB, or 10 miles southwest of Cheyenne, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Landspouts, winds in excess of 40 mph, and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Cheyenne, South Greeley, Warren AFB, Frontier Park, Warren Af Base, Fox Farm-College and South Greeley High. This includes the following highways... Interstate 25 in Wyoming between mile markers 1 and 12. Interstate 80 in Wyoming between mile markers 342 and 366. LANDSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
